001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.

004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Meters;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.proto.Transform3dProto;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.struct.Transform3dStruct;
011import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Distance;
012import edu.wpi.first.util.protobuf.ProtobufSerializable;
013import edu.wpi.first.util.struct.StructSerializable;
014import java.util.Objects;
015
016/** Represents a transformation for a Pose3d in the pose's frame. */
017public class Transform3d implements ProtobufSerializable, StructSerializable {
018  /**
019   * A preallocated Transform3d representing no transformation.
020   *
021   * <p>This exists to avoid allocations for common transformations.
022   */
023  public static final Transform3d kZero = new Transform3d();
024
025  private final Translation3d m_translation;
026  private final Rotation3d m_rotation;
027
028  /**
029   * Constructs the transform that maps the initial pose to the final pose.
030   *
031   * @param initial The initial pose for the transformation.
032   * @param last The final pose for the transformation.
033   */
034  public Transform3d(Pose3d initial, Pose3d last) {
035    // We are rotating the difference between the translations
036    // using a clockwise rotation matrix. This transforms the global
037    // delta into a local delta (relative to the initial pose).
038    m_translation =
039        last.getTranslation()
040            .minus(initial.getTranslation())
041            .rotateBy(initial.getRotation().unaryMinus());
042
043    m_rotation = last.getRotation().minus(initial.getRotation());
044  }
045
046  /**
047   * Constructs a transform with the given translation and rotation components.
048   *
049   * @param translation Translational component of the transform.
050   * @param rotation Rotational component of the transform.
051   */
052  public Transform3d(Translation3d translation, Rotation3d rotation) {
053    m_translation = translation;
054    m_rotation = rotation;
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Constructs a transform with x, y, and z translations instead of a separate Translation3d.
059   *
060   * @param x The x component of the translational component of the transform.
061   * @param y The y component of the translational component of the transform.
062   * @param z The z component of the translational component of the transform.
063   * @param rotation The rotational component of the transform.
064   */
065  public Transform3d(double x, double y, double z, Rotation3d rotation) {
066    m_translation = new Translation3d(x, y, z);
067    m_rotation = rotation;
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Constructs a transform with x, y, and z translations instead of a separate Translation3d. The
072   * X, Y, and Z translations will be converted to and tracked as meters.
073   *
074   * @param x The x component of the translational component of the transform.
075   * @param y The y component of the translational component of the transform.
076   * @param z The z component of the translational component of the transform.
077   * @param rotation The rotational component of the transform.
078   */
079  public Transform3d(Distance x, Distance y, Distance z, Rotation3d rotation) {
080    this(x.in(Meters), y.in(Meters), z.in(Meters), rotation);
081  }
082
083  /** Constructs the identity transform -- maps an initial pose to itself. */
084  public Transform3d() {
085    m_translation = Translation3d.kZero;
086    m_rotation = Rotation3d.kZero;
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Multiplies the transform by the scalar.
091   *
092   * @param scalar The scalar.
093   * @return The scaled Transform3d.
094   */
095  public Transform3d times(double scalar) {
096    return new Transform3d(m_translation.times(scalar), m_rotation.times(scalar));
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Divides the transform by the scalar.
101   *
102   * @param scalar The scalar.
103   * @return The scaled Transform3d.
104   */
105  public Transform3d div(double scalar) {
106    return times(1.0 / scalar);
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Composes two transformations. The second transform is applied relative to the orientation of
111   * the first.
112   *
113   * @param other The transform to compose with this one.
114   * @return The composition of the two transformations.
115   */
116  public Transform3d plus(Transform3d other) {
117    return new Transform3d(Pose3d.kZero, Pose3d.kZero.transformBy(this).transformBy(other));
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Returns the translation component of the transformation.
122   *
123   * @return The translational component of the transform.
124   */
125  public Translation3d getTranslation() {
126    return m_translation;
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Returns the X component of the transformation's translation.
131   *
132   * @return The x component of the transformation's translation.
133   */
134  public double getX() {
135    return m_translation.getX();
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Returns the Y component of the transformation's translation.
140   *
141   * @return The y component of the transformation's translation.
142   */
143  public double getY() {
144    return m_translation.getY();
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Returns the Z component of the transformation's translation.
149   *
150   * @return The z component of the transformation's translation.
151   */
152  public double getZ() {
153    return m_translation.getZ();
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Returns the X component of the transformation's translation in a measure.
158   *
159   * @return The x component of the transformation's translation in a measure.
160   */
161  public Distance getMeasureX() {
162    return m_translation.getMeasureX();
163  }
164
165  /**
166   * Returns the Y component of the transformation's translation in a measure.
167   *
168   * @return The y component of the transformation's translation in a measure.
169   */
170  public Distance getMeasureY() {
171    return m_translation.getMeasureY();
172  }
173
174  /**
175   * Returns the Z component of the transformation's translation in a measure.
176   *
177   * @return The z component of the transformation's translation in a measure.
178   */
179  public Distance getMeasureZ() {
180    return m_translation.getMeasureZ();
181  }
182
183  /**
184   * Returns the rotational component of the transformation.
185   *
186   * @return Reference to the rotational component of the transform.
187   */
188  public Rotation3d getRotation() {
189    return m_rotation;
190  }
191
192  /**
193   * Invert the transformation. This is useful for undoing a transformation.
194   *
195   * @return The inverted transformation.
196   */
197  public Transform3d inverse() {
198    // We are rotating the difference between the translations
199    // using a clockwise rotation matrix. This transforms the global
200    // delta into a local delta (relative to the initial pose).
201    return new Transform3d(
202        getTranslation().unaryMinus().rotateBy(getRotation().unaryMinus()),
203        getRotation().unaryMinus());
204  }
205
206  @Override
207  public String toString() {
208    return String.format("Transform3d(%s, %s)", m_translation, m_rotation);
209  }
210
211  /**
212   * Checks equality between this Transform3d and another object.
213   *
214   * @param obj The other object.
215   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
216   */
217  @Override
218  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
219    return obj instanceof Transform3d other
220        && other.m_translation.equals(m_translation)
221        && other.m_rotation.equals(m_rotation);
222  }
223
224  @Override
225  public int hashCode() {
226    return Objects.hash(m_translation, m_rotation);
227  }
228
229  /** Transform3d protobuf for serialization. */
230  public static final Transform3dProto proto = new Transform3dProto();
231
232  /** Transform3d struct for serialization. */
233  public static final Transform3dStruct struct = new Transform3dStruct();
234}
